title: Trump and Mamdani Strike Optimistic Tone, Sidestepping Past Critiques
summary: The meeting between President Trump and the incoming mayor of New York City was strikingly warm for two men who had expressed deep concerns about each other’s leadership.

title: ‘Fascist’? ‘Communist’? For an Afternoon, Trump and Mamdani Were Just 2 Guys From Queens.
summary: Acid insults were set aside as New York’s mayor-elect and the president promoted their shared goals.

title: The Trump-Mamdani Buddy Movie? It’s Getting Mixed Reviews.
summary: Zohran Mamdani and President Trump seemed to cast aside their months of traded insults, a development that seemed good for New York City but odd to some followers.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Says She Will Resign in January, After Break From Trump
summary: Ms. Greene, who was elected in 2020, had positioned herself as a die-hard Trump supporter until a series of recent ruptures with the president, who recently unendorsed her.

title: Supreme Court, For Now, Keeps in Place Texas Republican-Friendly Congressional Map
summary: State officials have asked the justices to allow it to use a newly redrawn map for the 2026 midterms, part of a nationwide redistricting push by President Trump.

title: RFK Jr. Says He Instructed CDC to Change Vaccines and Autism Language on Website
summary: In an interview, Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. cited gaps in vaccine safety research. His critics say he is ignoring a larger point: Vaccines save lives.

summary: The secretary of transportation kicked off a new civility campaign on Wednesday called “The Golden Age of Travel Starts With You.”

title: What Is Trump’s 28-Point Plan to End Russia’s War in Ukraine?
summary: President Trump is pressing Kyiv to accept an outcome that yields to President Vladimir V. Putin’s demands.

title: Russian Exiles See Europe Visa Rule as Blow Against Them, Not Putin
summary: The European Union said the decision was prompted by sabotage attacks in Europe, but Russians living abroad say Europe is punishing ordinary people.

title: As Trump Pushes on Russia-Ukraine Peace Plan, Zelensky’s Options Are Narrowing
summary: The Ukrainian president’s options are narrowing as he is confronted with a 28-point proposal drafted by American and Russian envoys.

title: Lawrence Krauss, Martin Nowak: The Professors Who Stayed Close With Epstein
summary: Even as the disgraced financier’s crimes were revealed, newly released emails show how academics at top universities stuck by Jeffrey Epstein, often seeking his help and offering it in return.

title: How Olivia Nuzzi and Ryan Lizza Became Main Characters on Social Media
summary: Love, politics and ethics collided as Olivia Nuzzi and Ryan Lizza went at it in a media sphere that rewards private revelations.

summary: The magazine, which recently hired the journalist, said it had been “taken by surprise” by new claims in an essay by her former fiancé, Ryan Lizza.

title: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott Moves to Restrict Muslims, Leaving Some Concerned
summary: Two decisions by the Texas governor this week, including directing authorities to investigate an Islamic organization, come as the state sees an increase in anti-Muslim rhetoric.

title: Texas A&M Wrong to Fire Professor Melissa McCoul Over Gender Lesson, Panel Rules
summary: The firing put the school at the center of national debates over gender identity and academic freedom. A faculty panel ruled unanimously against the termination.

title: U.S. Defends Decision to Seek Death Penalty for Luigi Mangione
summary: Prosecutors argue that Mr. Mangione can receive a fair trial, despite his lawyers’ concerns about “damaging” statements from the attorney general about the murder case.

title: Eli Lilly, Drug Maker of Zepbound and Mounjaro, Reaches $1 Trillion in Value
summary: The 150-year-old drugmaker is the first company in health care to hit the milestone.

title: Watch a ‘Wonderful’ Moment From ‘Wicked: For Good’
summary: The director Jon M. Chu narrates a sequence from his film featuring Ariana Grande, Cynthia Erivo and Jeff Goldblum performing the song “Wonderful.”

summary: There are widespread attacks across the country affecting many religious and ethnic groups. Many of them defy a simple explanation.

summary: Students and teachers were taken captive from a Catholic school in the latest in a wave of such attacks in the country.

title: The Moon Was an Inside Job
summary: New research suggests that Theia, the object whose collision with Earth is theorized to have caused the formation of the moon, came from closer to the sun.

title: Saturn’s Rings Seem as if They’re About to Disappear: Here’s Why
summary: During the weekend, the orbits of Earth and Saturn will combine to create an interplanetary optical illusion for anyone with a good telescope and clear skies.

summary: Since his election, Zohran Mamdani has made some surprisingly pragmatic or traditional choices — including his surreal meeting with President Trump.

title: America Is Setting a Trap for Itself
summary: The United States, not China, seems determined to upend the global order.

title: Tyson Foods to Shut Major Beef Facility in Nebraska
summary: The processing plant, in Lexington, employs more than 3,000 workers. It is expected to close in January.

title: How Newsom and Trump Have Made California the Unlikely Center of 2025 Politics
summary: Thanks to Newsom, Trump and redistricting, the deep-blue state is in the thick of national politics.

title: A Colossal, Hidden Pile of Trash Ignites Outcry in Britain
summary: The discovery of a mountain of garbage near a highway is the latest example of what experts say is a growing problem of criminal organizations profiting from illegal dumping.

title: 3 Children Are Injured in Grizzly Bear Attack in British Columbia
summary: The children were among 11 people who were hurt when a grizzly attacked a school group in a remote part of British Columbia, the authorities said.
